title: Dungeons and Discourse Third Edition: The dialectic continues
summary:
Key ideas
- Third Edition of Dungeons and Discourse is now available to download.
- New spells have been added, including player-suggested spells like Armor Fati and Summon Dire C. Elegans.
- Revamped prestige class system with 21 books to choose from.
- Righteousness statistic has been replaced with Merit and Virtue.
- Creatures now have a single hit point statistic which can be inflicted physically or mentally.
- Combat has been simplified with a front row/back row system instead of a giant grid.
- Five "spell slots" have been replaced with a single Will statistic.
- Currency has switched from gold to benthamite.
- Items have been reworked.

Key learnings
- The Third Edition of Dungeons and Discourse has numerous changes and improvements to the game mechanics.
- The prestige class system has been made more accessible and easier to understand.
- The new Merit and Virtue system adds more complexity to ethical decisions in the game.
- Combat has been streamlined.
- The benthamite currency reflects the utilitarian philosophy of the game.

Key questions
- Are there any typos, obvious glaring balance problems, spells/classes/mechanics that are referenced and then don’t exist/were never explained, or things you really don’t like?
- Who will help convert the rulebook into a wiki?
- When will the flagship campaign, Fermat’s Last Stand, begin?
- How can players use the new Merit and Virtue system to make ethical decisions in the game?
